mail.validation
Class AddressVerifier

java.lang.Object
  mail.validation.AddressVerifier

public class AddressVerifier
extends java.lang.Object

Class that lets you verify existence of email addresses

Author:
Hasan Imam

Field Detail

SMTP_PORT

private static final int SMTP_PORT
Port to use for connection. Values: 25 (SMTP), 587 (Submission), 465 (legacy secure SMTP - violates specification).

invalidAddrs

private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> invalidAddrs
List of address that realistically should not be on the user list. Used to test if the server is actually using a lookup or not. Add more if necessary.

Constructor Detail

AddressVerifier

public AddressVerifier(java.lang.String serverName)
                throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                       java.io.IOException
Construct an AddressVerifier object. Creates a connection with the given server. Checks service status and sends an SMTP HELO. Constructor fails if fails to connect or performs these steps. Note that the connection is closed during object destruction.

Parameters:
serverName - Server to connect to (e.g. 173.194.78.27 or alt3.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com)
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.UnknownHostException

AddressVerifier

public AddressVerifier(java.lang.String serverName,
                       java.lang.String senderAddress)
                throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                       java.io.IOException
Construct an AddressVerifier object. Creates a connection with the given server. Checks service status and sends an SMTP HELO. Constructor fails if fails to connect or performs these steps. Note that the connection is closed during object destruction.

Parameters:
serverName - Server to connect to (e.g. 173.194.78.27 or alt3.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com)
senderAddress - Sender email address to use (e.g. asdf@gmail.com)
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.UnknownHostException

doesAddrExist

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> doesAddrExist(java.util.List<java.lang.String> addressList)
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
Given a list of addresses, checks if they exist in the mail servers registry

Throws:
java.io.IOException

serverHasRegistry

public boolean serverHasRegistry()
                          throws java.io.IOException
Some SMTP servers actually don't have any user list and they reply OK even for the wrong email addresses. This function checks whether the server has a registry or not. It tries to verify some possibly invalid email addresses and checks the server reply. Note that the result is not 100% accurate.

Returns:
True if it thinks server has user registry. False if it thinks server is using a 'catch-all' scheme and not verifying addresses against any registry
Throws:
java.io.IOException

specifySender

private void specifySender()
                    throws java.io.IOException
Call this once to set the sender for each transaction

Throws:
java.io.IOException

reset

private void reset()
            throws java.io.IOException
This clears the MAIL FROM: and RCPT TO: address stacks, throwing out any message delivery in progress, and resetting the connection back to the state it was in just after 'HELO'. Call this at the end of each transaction.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

sendCommand

private java.lang.String sendCommand(java.lang.String command)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Send an SMTP command to the server and return the server reply.

Parameters:
command - Properly formatted command string to send to server
Returns:
Reply from server

java.io.IOException
